docs.snippet: Reds pitcher Aroldis Chapman was scheduled to have surgery after a line drive shattered bones above his nose and left eye, a play that stirred uncomfortable memories for the Rays....
docs.lead_paragraph: Reds pitcher Aroldis Chapman was scheduled to have surgery after a line drive shattered bones above his nose and left eye, a play that stirred uncomfortable memories for the Rays.
docs.abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column; Cincinnati Reds pitcher Aroldis Chapman is scheduled to have surgery after a line drive shattered bones above his nose and left eye; play has stirred uncomfortable memories around locker room forTampa Bay Rays, whose pitcher Alex Cobb took a liner to his ear in June, 2013, giving him a concussion and vertigo and taking him out of lineup for two months.

docs.abstract: New York Mets are still uncertain whether either Ike Davis or Lucas Duda, who are competing for the team's starting first baseman’s job, will be ready to start the season, with only 10 days before opening day.
